location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from James Morley, East India Company Resident at Bushire, to Henry Moore, East India Company Agent at Bussora [Basra]

mods.abstract: The letter relays Captain McKenly's view that the cruizers are in inadequate condition, informing that they will return to Basra and the Revengewill take over the patrol down the Gulf as soon as ready. Confirmation of cash received is given, with a request for more.This letter is incomplete. As a result, note date is given. The Bushire Residency went into abeyance in January 1769, so it is likely this letter was written between 27 December 1768 and the end of January 1769.
